trans-unit.source: Storage
trans-unit.target: Storage

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Storage is a massively scalable, highly available, and elastic cloud storage solution that empowers developers and IT professionals to build large-scale modern applications.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Storage is a massively scalable, highly available, and elastic cloud storage solution that empowers developers and IT professionals to build large-scale modern applications.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage is accessible from anywhere in the world, from any type of application, whether it’s running in the cloud, on the desktop, on an on-premises server, or on a mobile or tablet device.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage is accessible from anywhere in the world, from any type of application, whether it’s running in the cloud, on the desktop, on an on-premises server, or on a mobile or tablet device.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of Azure Storage, see <externalLink><linkText>Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of Azure Storage, see <externalLink><linkText>Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: An Azure storage account is a secure account that gives you access to services in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: An Azure storage account is a secure account that gives you access to services in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Your storage account provides the unique namespace for your storage resources.
trans-unit.target: Your storage account provides the unique namespace for your storage resources.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of storage accounts:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of storage accounts:

trans-unit.source: A standard storage account includes Blob, Table, Queue, and File storage.
trans-unit.target: A standard storage account includes Blob, Table, Queue, and File storage.

trans-unit.source: To create a standard storage account, see <externalLink><linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-create-storage-account/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To create a standard storage account, see <externalLink><linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-create-storage-account/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A premium storage account currently supports Azure Virtual Machine disks only.
trans-unit.target: A premium storage account currently supports Azure Virtual Machine disks only.

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage is available by request via the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/services/preview/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage is available by request via the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/services/preview/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For an in-depth overview of Azure Premium Storage, see <externalLink><linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521898</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For an in-depth overview of Azure Premium Storage, see <externalLink><linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521898</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Before you can create a storage account, you must have an Azure subscription, which is a plan that gives you access to a variety of Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Before you can create a storage account, you must have an Azure subscription, which is a plan that gives you access to a variety of Azure services.

trans-unit.source: You can create up to 100 uniquely named storage accounts with a single subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can create up to 100 uniquely named storage accounts with a single subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Storage Pricing Details</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/</linkUri></externalLink> for information on volume pricing.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Storage Pricing Details</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/</linkUri></externalLink> for information on volume pricing.

trans-unit.source: You can get started with Azure with a <externalLink><linkText>free trial</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can get started with Azure with a <externalLink><linkText>free trial</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Once you decide to purchase a plan, you can choose from a variety of <externalLink><linkText>purchase options</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Once you decide to purchase a plan, you can choose from a variety of <externalLink><linkText>purchase options</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If you’re an <externalLink><linkText>MSDN subscriber</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/</linkUri></externalLink>, you get free monthly credits that you can use with Azure services, including Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: If you’re an <externalLink><linkText>MSDN subscriber</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/</linkUri></externalLink>, you get free monthly credits that you can use with Azure services, including Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Services
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Services

trans-unit.source: The Azure Storage services are Blob storage, Table Storage, Queue Storage, and File Storage:
trans-unit.target: The Azure Storage services are Blob storage, Table Storage, Queue Storage, and File Storage:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Blob Storage</embeddedLabel> stores file data.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Blob Storage</embeddedLabel> stores file data.

trans-unit.source: A blob can be any type of text or binary data, such as a document, media file, or application installer.
trans-unit.target: A blob can be any type of text or binary data, such as a document, media file, or application installer.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Table Storage</embeddedLabel> stores structured datasets.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Table Storage</embeddedLabel> stores structured datasets.

trans-unit.source: Table storage is a NoSQL key-attribute data store, which allows for rapid development and fast access to large quantities of data.
trans-unit.target: Table storage is a NoSQL key-attribute data store, which allows for rapid development and fast access to large quantities of data.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with Table Storage
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Table Storage

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Queue Storage</embeddedLabel> provides reliable messaging for workflow processing and for communication between components of cloud services.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Queue Storage</embeddedLabel> provides reliable messaging for workflow processing and for communication between components of cloud services.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with Queue Storage
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Queue Storage

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>File storage (Preview)</embeddedLabel> offers shared storage for legacy applications using the standard SMB 2.1 protocol.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>File storage (Preview)</embeddedLabel> offers shared storage for legacy applications using the standard SMB 2.1 protocol.

trans-unit.source: Azure virtual machines and cloud services can share file data across application components via mounted shares, and on-premise applications can access file data in a share via the File service REST API.
trans-unit.target: Azure virtual machines and cloud services can share file data across application components via mounted shares, and on-premise applications can access file data in a share via the File service REST API.

trans-unit.source: File storage is available by request via the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><linkUri>C:\en-us\services\preview\</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: File storage is available by request via the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><linkUri>C:\en-us\services\preview\</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with File Storage
trans-unit.target: Get Started with File Storage
